intro: Rudgea acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Rudgea acuminata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds.
